overview: From 2025-12-01 to 2026-01-01, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 18 new PRs (11 merged), 4 new issues, and 32 active contributors.

topIssues.title: SPIKE: Decide how to support challenging ZK games
topIssues.author: ajsutton
topIssues.body:
Output is a P/PS deciding whether to:
* Support zk games in op-challenger (#18321) 
* Use succinct challenger for challenging ZK games
* Integrate challenging into proposer

topIssues.title: [Tracker] EVM Engineering: contract interfaces improvements
topIssues.author: smartcontracts
topIssues.body:
We're now using contract interfaces in the contracts repository to help improve devex and compile time across the board. We have a number of follow-up issues to address to make sure that the experience with interfaces is as clean as possible.

- [ ] #12412
- [x] #11683

topIssues.title: [M1] op-node: Light CL: Disable Derivation
topIssues.author: pcw109550
topIssues.body:
- Goal: Introduce the `--l2.unsafe-only` flag to run op-node without derivation.
- Definition of Done:
    - op-node supports`--l2.unsafe-only`, disabling local derivation entirely.
    - Node successfully reaches the unsafe tip.
    - Acceptance tests: Using sync-tester with op-sepolia.
    - Deployment: Verifier node on devnet with derivation disabled.

topIssues.title: contracts: op-succinct dispute game tests
topIssues.author: stevennevins
topIssues.body:
Add unit tests for the `OPSuccinctFaultDisputeGame` contract to verify the ZK-based fault dispute game logic works correctly.

Port tests from op-succinct repo and update to follow conventions of our repo

topIssues.title: kona: Integrate op-succinct changes into kona
topIssues.author: pauldowman

topPRs.title: op-supernode: Superroot API Activity
topPRs.author: axelKingsley

topPRs.title: op-interop-filter: Service skeleton with flags and metrics
topPRs.author: karlfloersch
topPRs.body:
---------

<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Adds the op-interop-filter service skeleton:
1. CLI flags with StringSliceFlag for `--l2-rpcs` (chain ID queried from RPC)
2. Service lifecycle (start/stop) following op-service patterns
3. RPC server with supervisor namespace for `checkAccessList`
4. Metrics with `doc` subcommand for documentation
5. Stub backend (actual logic in follow-up PR)

This service validates interop executing messages for op-geth/op-reth transaction filtering. Any reorg triggers failsafe which disables all interop transactions.

**Tests**

Unit tests will be added in the follow-up logic PR. This skeleton PR focuses on service structure.

completedItems.title: op-batcher: fix max channel duration tracking for large block backlogs (cont)
feat: add new check for strict pragma
completedItems.body: Adds a new check in the contracts package that confirms that all source contracts are using a strict pragma instead of a dynamic one.

completedItems.title: feat: add OPCMv2 tests for existing behaviors
completedItems.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
This PR adds tests for AddGameType and UpdatePrestate behaviors in OPCMv2. It also adds tests for OPContracts

completedItems.title: op-challenger: Move GameType to the game/type package instead of game/fault/type
completedItems.body:
**Description**

Game types are not specific to fault dispute games. As we introduce ZK games we want to maintain good separation between the fault dispute game handling code and the zk game handling code.



**Metadata**

#18321

completedItems.title: chore(op-acceptance-tests): flake-shake; slack notifications for failures only
Add Openchain import on CI
completedItems.body: Sometimes while working on superchain-ops or other repositories we get some custom error signature that can be hard to track. A useful tool is using `cast 4bd <sig>` . However this gets the signatures from https://openchain.xyz/ signature d

completedItems.title: ci: split bake workflow in protected/unprotected flows
completedItems.body:
This change improves security and it will also greatly reduce usage of our container registry. It splits the execution of the docker bake GHA workflow in 2:
- protected branches/tags: continues as is now to push images to GCP
- PRs: skip
